article_text:
A major conservative complaint about the GOP Congress is that it hasn’t done enough to exploit its constitutional power of the purse. So it’s worth noting that the House lawsuit challenging President Obama’s usurpation of that power continues to advance in federal court.

Federal Judge Rosemary Collyer ruled last month that the House of Representatives has legal standing to sue Mr. Obama for continuing to hand out cost-sharing payments under the Affordable Care Act even though Congress had never appropriated the money. On...

twitter.description: The House suit against Obama continues to advance in court, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Reclaiming the Spending Power

og.description: The House suit against Obama continues to advance in court, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
og.title: Reclaiming the Spending Power

article_summary:
So it’s worth noting that the House lawsuit challenging President Obama’s usurpation of that power continues to advance in federal court.
A major conservative complaint about the GOP Congress is that it hasn’t done enough to exploit its constitutional power of the purse.
Federal Judge Rosemary Collyer ruled last month that the House of Representatives has legal standing to sue Mr. Obama for continuing to hand out cost-sharing payments under the Affordable Care Act even though Congress had never appropriated the money.
